skill.name: quality-fixer
skill.description: Automatically apply safe quality fixes including formatting (Black, isort), linting (Ruff auto-fixes), and resolve formatter conflicts. Use when quality checks fail or before committing code.
skill.summary: Automatically apply safe quality fixes including formatting (Black, isort), linting (Ruff auto-fixes...
skill.author: Atyantik

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. The skill provides instructions for applying standard Python formatting tools (Black, isort, Ruff) to project files. No network calls, no credential access, no code execution beyond standard development tools.

content.user_title: Apply Python Code Formatting and Linting Fixes
content.value_statement: Manual code formatting takes time and creates inconsistent style. This skill automatically applies Black formatting, isort import sorting, and Ruff linting fixes to keep code clean and consistent.
actual_capabilities: Apply Black code formatting to Python files
Resolve Black vs Ruff formatter conflicts
Generate fix reports with git diff integration
limitations: Only fixes auto-fixable issues - manual review needed for complex linting
Does not fix logic errors or business logic problems
Does not write or improve docstrings

use_cases.title: Pre-commit Quality Check
use_cases.description: Format and lint code before every commit to maintain consistent style

use_cases.title: CI/CD Integration
use_cases.description: Run local fixes when CI quality checks fail to resolve issues quickly

use_cases.title: Codebase Cleanup
use_cases.description: Clean up formatting issues across a large codebase efficiently

prompt_templates.title: Format All Files
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply quality fixes to the entire project using Black, isort, and Ruff. Run make format and make lint with --fix. Show me a summary of all changes made.

prompt_templates.title: Fix Specific File
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix quality issues in src/path/to/file.py. Apply Black formatting, isort, and Ruff auto-fixes. Show me the diff of changes.

prompt_templates.title: Preview First
prompt_templates.prompt: Preview quality fixes for src/ directory. Run all formatters and linters in dry-run mode (--check --diff). Show me exactly what would change without applying fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Resolve Conflicts
prompt_templates.prompt: Resolve Black and Ruff formatter conflicts in the project. Run both formatters, identify disagreements, and apply conflict resolution strategies like message variable extraction and line break adjustments.

output_examples.input: Apply quality fixes to the entire project
output: - Sorted imports with isort in 8 files

best_practices: Run quality fixes before every commit to maintain consistent style
Review changes with git diff instead of blindly accepting all fixes
Run make test after fixing to ensure no breaking changes
anti_patterns: Applying fixes without reviewing what changed
Ignoring formatter conflicts instead of resolving them
Relying on auto-fix for complex linting issues that need manual review

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: Yes. It runs Black, isort, and Ruff with --fix which will modify Python files in your project.

faq.question: What formatting tools does it use?
faq.answer: The skill uses Black for code formatting, isort for import sorting, and Ruff for linting auto-fixes.

faq.question: Can I preview changes before applying?
faq.answer: Yes. Use dry-run mode with --check --diff flags to preview all changes without modifying files.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill that only runs standard Python development tools on your local project files.

faq.question: What if auto-fix breaks my code?
faq.answer: You can revert changes with git checkout -- <file>. The skill recommends committing before applying fixes.

faq.question: How is this different from running make commands?
faq.answer: This skill orchestrates all quality tools together, resolves conflicts between formatters, and provides a comprehensive report of all fixes applied.
